document.masterDocTitle: Ampithoid amphipods from the South Pacific: Papua New Guinea, French Polynesia and New Caledonia

subSubSection.paragraph:
New Caledonia : Male, 9 mm , dissected, three slides, AM P.84595, Recif Ricaudy (
22 ◦ 18 ′ 14 ′′ S
,
166 ◦ 26 ′ 09 ′′ E
), 1.5 m , coral rubble, 30 October 1995 , coll. A.A. Myers (NCL-3); female, 9 mm , dissected, one slide, AM P.84596, Recif Ricaudy (
22 ◦ 18 ′ 14 ′′ S
,
166 ◦ 26 ′ 09 ′′ E
), 1.5 m , coral rubble, 30 October 1995 , coll. A.A. Myers (NCL-3); one specimen AM P.84597, Recif Ricaudy (
22 ◦ 18 ′ 14 ′′ S
,
166 ◦ 26 ′ 09 ′′ E
), 1.5 m , coral rubble, 30 October 1995 , coll. A.A. Myers (NCL-3); one specimen AM P.84598, Recif Ricaudy (
22 ◦ 18 ′ 14 ′′ S
,
166 ◦ 26 ′ 09 ′′ E
), 0.5 m , brown alga
Padina sp.
, 4 November 1995 , coll. A.A. Myers (NCL-19); four specimens , AM P.84599, Roche Percé, Poé Plage (
22 ◦ 00 ′ S
,
166 ◦ 00 ′ E
), 0.3 m , brown alga
Sargassum sp.
and
Padina sp.
from rocky shore, 19 November 1995 , coll. A.A. Myers (NCL-132); 13 specimens , AM P.84600, south of Thio (
21 ◦ 36 ′ S
,
166 ◦ 13 ′ E
), 1 m , red alga, 20 November 1995 , coll. I. Takeuchi (NCL-150); two male specimens, AM P.84601, Poé Plage (
21 ◦ 36 ′ 25 ′′ S
,
165 ◦ 22 ′ 44 ′′ E
), 1–2 m , brown alga
Sargassum sp.
, 19 November 1995 , coll. J.K. Lowry (NCL-212); one specimen AM P.84602, Poé Plage (
21 ◦ 36 ′ 25 ′′ S
,
165 ◦ 22 ′ 44 ′′ E
), 1–2 m , red algae, 19 November 1995 , coll. J.K. Lowry (NCL-213); three specimens , AM P.84603, Thio (
21 ◦ 36 ′ S
,
166 ◦ 13 ′ E
), 1 m , living coral
Acropora sp.
from fringing reef, 20 November 1995 , coll. A.A. Myers (NCL-216).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Loyalty Islands : female specimen AM P.84604, north coast of Lifou , Dokin Village (
20 ◦ 42 ′ 09 ′′ S
,
167 ◦ 09 ′ 54 ′′ E
),
6 m
, red alga,
28 November 1995
, coll. I. Takeuchi (NCL- 233); three specimens , AM P.84605, Baie de Santal , Pointe de Easo , Lifou (
20 ◦ 47 ′ 16 ′′ S
,
167 ◦ 07 ′ 20 ′′ E
),
1 m
, brown alga
Sargassum sp.
,
28 November 1995
, coll. I. Takeuchi (NCL-237)
.

Paragrubia vorax Chevreux, 1901
has been widely reported throughout the Indo- Pacific. This is the second report of the species from New Caledonia following on from Ledoyer (1984) .
